poem:
Smoke Over Athens

The earth speaks in tongues of flame,
and Athens, ancient city,
breathes memories in smoke.
Sky darkened by history,
the cries of forest commandos merge
with echoes of vanished oracles.
Close your windows, children;
the past is burning.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
